question: Which Indian state has recently declared the disease caused by the novel coronavirus as a "state calamity"?
explanation:
The state Government of Kerala declared the disease caused by the novel coronavirus as a \"state calamity\". This declaration comes at the backdrop of three people of the state being tested positive for coronavirus.
Kerala reported the first infection from the virus in India and the person is being treated in isolation wards. Later two other patients, who are the students of a medical college in Wuhan, China are also diagnosed with the virus infection. The novel coronavirus was first reported in Chinaâ€™s Wuhan city and has spread to nearly 25 other countries.
